text: create a redirect map and import into the url redirects in settings

I just tried to upload a “HubSpot Video” and it seems the VidYard integration is broken even though my account is still connected.   The video just uploads as a standard MP4 and then covers the text above.

Is anyone else experiencing this BUG?

You also can create a flexible redirect for instance if you were changing from /blog to /news - you could do <http://info.example.com/blog/{rest-of-url}> -> <http://info.example.com/news/{rest-of-url}>

Is the video not wrapped in `{% video_player %}` HubL when you check the source code? If so, you may need to agree to Vidyard ToS in the File Manager, or toggle on embedding for that file in the File Manager.

I’m unable to reproduce on a test page in my portal, so it might be something specific to your portal as mentioned above wrt ToS, or perhaps page/template/styles/etc. Does the issue occur when you add videos to very basic templates?
Hey <@UDPJ43B39>.  Nope it isn’t wrapped in HubL as it normally would be and as others are on the same page.  I’ll check the ToS for VidYard and see if that’s the issue.

<@UDPJ43B39> toggling on the EMBED feature from the file manager fixed the issue.  Thank you!  The other videos I uploaded didn’t have this issue uploading directly though the CMS. Hence why I was confused.
Yeah I have seen one other report of this same thing, will flag it for the team. :thumbsup:

Anyone have much experience setting up blog subscriptions in chatflows? It seems to me that if HubSpot thinks an email address is already subscribed it will not show the subscription section of the flow again. This is even if the contact is not in the contact database. Is there a way to override this?
<@U22PKFRU5>, my company has a gratitude channel for praising people who have been extremely helpful. We should have one here
With that being said I, would like to express gratitude to <@UQERM7BLY> who has been pretty actively helping people on here :pray::raised_hands:
Including playing with me on an issue that ended up be a stupid mistake on my part :faceplam:
